thread.title: Unapproved Lilly Lung-Cancer Drug Stirs Price Debate
thread.title_full: Unapproved Lilly Lung-Cancer Drug Stirs Price Debate - WSJ

author: Peter Loftus
title: Unapproved Lilly Lung-Cancer Drug Stirs Price Debate
text:
An experimental Eli Lilly & Co. lung-cancer drug hasn’t reached the market, but some doctors are already weighing in on how much it should cost—arguing the price should be below average because the drug extended patient lives by only six to seven weeks in a clinical trial.
The pre-emptive price proposal—published Thursday by the medical journal JAMA Oncology—is a sign of the rising debate over drug pricing. Cancer doctors have become increasingly vocal in their criticism, saying the costs don’t seem to be tied to the... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
